sources.data_found: Gemini Computing Cluster: 344 CPU cores, 80 GPUs, 1.3 TB RAM, 135 TFLOPs peak (GPU model not specified).

Biochemistry & Molecular Biology Department operates 8 GPU servers, each with 4 GPUs, totaling 32 GPUs; 788 teraflops compute power (GPU model not specified). Also describes Aries CPU cluster (no GPUs mentioned).
Remote Sensing Lab: Dell PowerEdge R750 with 2 NVIDIA H100 80GB GPUs; also lists a Dell Precision 7920 with NVIDIA Quadro RTX 8000.
Campuswide HPC cluster 'Libra' installed/tested summer 2025; mentions 'advanced GPU nodes' but does not publish GPU counts/models.

student_data.notes: Searched specifically for 2024-2025 / Fall 2024 CS enrollment (majors) for Saint Louis University using the requested query order (CS enrollment Fall 2024; CS department facts 2024; CDS 2024-2025; registrar/enrollment statistics 2024; and site:cs.slu.edu enrollment 2024). The only official SLU source that appears to contain current enrollment data is SLU Office of Institutional Research (OIR) “Student Enrollment Dashboard” (linked from OIR Institutional Data), but the dashboard’s underlying data/visuals are embedded and not accessible as extractable text, and OIR’s “Final Census Reports” are hosted on a restricted Google Site requiring SLUNet login. I did not find any publicly accessible SLU page that explicitly states Fall 2024 (or AY 2024-2025) Computer Science enrollment counts split by undergraduate / MS / PhD. Per your rule rejecting 2023 or earlier, I did not use older Common Data Set pages (e.g., 2021-2022) or third-party enrollment sites.

other_high_vram_gpus.model: NVIDIA Tesla K80 (estimated; Gemini Computing Cluster GPU model not stated)
other_high_vram_gpus.vram_note: K80 typically 12GB per GPU (approx; not stated in source)
Source claims 96GB GDDR6 (spec commonly listed as 48GB; source may be inaccurate)

gpu_resources.notes:
Clusters found and node×GPU calculations:
- Remote Sensing Lab (Dell PowerEdge R750): 1 node × 2 H100 (assumed PCIe based on server class) = 2 H100 PCIe.
- Biochemistry & Molecular Biology 'GPU servers' (departmental): 8 servers × 4 GPUs/server = 32 GPUs total. GPU model not stated; estimated as P100 for counting purposes due to lack of model info.
- Gemini Computing Cluster (most recent addition cited on Pharm/Phys resources page): total GPUs stated as 80 but nodes/GPUs-per-node not given; assumed 20 nodes × 4 GPUs/node = 80 GPUs. GPU model not stated; estimated as Tesla K80 (older-generation) based on relatively low stated cluster peak of 135 TFLOPs for 80 GPUs.
- Campuswide Libra cluster (installed summer 2025): GPU nodes mentioned but no public node/GPU counts or GPU model found in accessible sources; excluded from totals.
- Aries cluster: CPU-focused description only; no GPUs specified; treated as 0 GPUs.

analysis_notes: Data collected via multi-query approach: separate student and GPU searches.
